controllers

Class LeaderboardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.LeaderboardController

  • public class LeaderboardController
extends java.lang.Object
    Leader board controller. Allows the user to view the leader boards for each level.
    Author:
    Josh Codd

    • Method Detail

      • addLeaderboardRow

        private void addLeaderboardRow(int index,
                               PlayerProfile currentProfile)
        Adds a profile to the leaderboard. If the profile is top three then their respective medal is displayed.
        Parameters:
        index - The players position in the leaderboard.
        currentProfile - The profile to add to leaderboard.

      • getLevels

        private javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> getLevels()
        Gets the names of all game level files.
        Returns:
        All game file names.

      • handleBack

        public void handleBack()
        Returns back to the main menu.

      • handleChange

        public void handleChange()
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Handles a change in the levels dropdown box. When changed, the leaderboard also changes to whatever file name is selected.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If leaderboard file does not exist.

      • handleMute

        public void handleMute()
        Mutes the background audio if its currently un-muted, and un-mutes the background audio if it is currently muted.

      • setBackgroundMusic

        public void setBackgroundMusic(javafx.scene.media.MediaView backgroundMusic)
        Sets the media (audio) to be played in the background of the menu.
        Parameters:
        backgroundMusic - The audio to be played.

      • setDropdown

        public void setDropdown()
        Sets the dropdown box to include all game file names.

      • setPrimaryStage

        public void setPrimaryStage(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Sets the stage in which the application is being displayed on.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - The stage being displayed on.
